content:
Diagnosis
	1. Pancreatic large cell neuroendocrine carcinoma
	Date of diagnosis
	January 2024

	Treatment aim
	Curative intent

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	15 Jan 2024 Diagnostic laparoscopy and biopsy
	Chemotherapy
	1. Carboplatin/Etoposide commenced 01 Feb 2024
	2. Completed 4 cycles with excellent response

	Radiotherapy
	Not indicated at present

	Clinical studies
	None

	Current disease status
	Partial response to treatment

	Current issues
	None significant

	Summary of consultation
	Reviewed today following completion of cycle 4 carboplatin/etoposide. Latest CT shows excellent partial response with 60% reduction in pancreatic primary (now 3.2cm from 8cm) and complete resolution of peritoneal disease. Chromogranin A has normalized from 325 to 42. Performance status remains 1. Blood parameters are satisfactory for continuation of treatment.

	Further investigations
	CT chest/abdomen/pelvis after cycle 6
	Chromogranin A monitoring

	Medication prescribed
	Continue with cycles 5-6 carboplatin AUC5/etoposide 100mg/m2

	Follow up
	Next oncology follow up in 3 weeks pre cycle 5

	Required GP actions
	None

cancer_timeline.value: Initial pancreatic primary 8cm with peritoneal disease
CT shows 60% reduction in pancreatic primary to 3.2cm and complete resolution of peritoneal disease

patient_facts.value: Blood parameters satisfactory for continuing treatment

status_updates.value: Stage IIIA pancreatic neuroendocrine carcinoma showing excellent response to carboplatin/etoposide chemotherapy with significant reduction in disease burden
60% reduction in pancreatic primary and complete resolution of peritoneal disease
CT chest/abdomen/pelvis after cycle 6 and Chromogranin A monitoring
